column4: i repeat my question, when i try to boot on my ubuntu im getting this...
or missing modules, devices: cat/proc/modules ls /dev
ALERT! /dev/disk/by-uuid/ed8e6c38-6385-4810-9b20-8dd597e2a811 does not exist, Dropping to a shell
something's wrong in your /etc/fstab it's looking for a drive that you dont have
and what should i do to boot on this linux?
idk. i just know what the error says and what that means in english :p
you can edit grub when it starts up
hit esc to enter grub, then e to edit the line you're on
make the changes, then b to boot it
there should be an option on the screen where you log in
i dont got options im in console
and go to the login screen
did you just install kde or did you install kubuntu-desktop?
try installing kubuntu-desktop then so you have the whole thing
